intro: Dammara robusta, commonly known as the robust dammara, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
